TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to Ayuntamineto of Nacogdoches, 05-30-1833

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to Ayuntamiento of Nacogdoches, Matamoros, May 30, 1833. Conditions in Mexico tranquil and attitude toward Texas considerate. Custom-houses to be reestablished to stop contraband tobacco trade, Austin has assured authorities that people will support the Government.
barker_notes.barker_footnotes: From Nacogdoches archives, Texas State Library. There is a Spanish copy in the Bexar archives. It is uncertain whether the original was in English or Spanish.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 975-977

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Ayuntamiento of Nacogdoches, Matamoros, May 30, 1833. Conditions in Mexico tranquil and attitude toward Texas considerate. Custom- houses to be reestablished to stop contraband tobacco trade, Austin has assured authorities that people will support the Government.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Matamoras */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="05-30-1833">30th May 1833*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*The *person_mentioned*public */person_mentioned*was very much agitated in this place by false reports and rumors from *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*—but they have been removed by the statement of facts which I have laid before his *person_mentioned*Excellency the Commandant General Don Vicente Fillisola*/person_mentioned* who assures me of the paternal intentions of the *person_mentioned*Govt */person_mentioned*towards the *person_mentioned*People of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*. There never has been any cause for doubt that such are its intentions—all the vague rumours that have been circulated as to the marching of a large *person_mentioned*Army */person_mentioned*to *location_mentioned*Tejas */location_mentioned*with hostile views are utterly false. The *person_mentioned*Genl */person_mentioned*has ordered the reestablishment of the *location_mentioned*Custom Houses*/location_mentioned* and the *location_mentioned*military Garrisons*/location_mentioned*, and will do so for the purpose of protecting the public Revenue and stopping the scandalous contraband that has been carried on in Tobacco from the *location_mentioned*Ports of Tejas*/location_mentioned*. I have assured him that he will receive the support of the *person_mentioned*Colonist */person_mentioned*in sustaining the Revenue laws and that they would do their duty faithfully as *person_mentioned*Mexican Citizens*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I have pledged my honor for the Truth of this declaration and have full confidence that the *person_mentioned*People of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* will not forfeit the pledge I have made but will by their acts prove its correctness and that the revenue laws can be enforced without the aid of large *location_mentioned*military Garrisons*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr. George Fisher*/person_mentioned* will leave here shortly to enter upon his duties of *person_mentioned*Collector of*location_mentioned* Galveston Bay*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* with only sufficient number of *person_mentioned*Troops*/person_mentioned* for necessary *person_mentioned*Guards */person_mentioned*etc.*/p*
*p*Whatever Ideas and opinions may have heretofore existed as to *person_mentioned*Mr Fisher*/person_mentioned* they should now be consigned to oblivion and forgotten. He returns as an *person_mentioned*officer of the Govt*/person_mentioned* and as such it is the duty of the People to respect and sustain him. I will also observe that I have investigated very minutely all the past transactions in which he was concerned and have formed the opinion that the excitements which unfortunately grew out of them were produced by misconception and suspicion too hastily entertained and not from intention to do wrong or injure any one. I believe there were misconceptions on both sides and probably as much on one part as on the other—*person_mentioned*Mr. Fisher*/person_mentioned* will make a usefull *person_mentioned*collector */person_mentioned*his knowledge of the English language will give more facilities in his intercourse with the people than could exist with a *person_mentioned*collector */person_mentioned*who was unacquainted with that language. I therefore particularly recommend the utmost harmony and that he be sustained in the discharge of his duties by all, regardless of the clamour of a few *person_mentioned*Transient Traders*/person_mentioned* who would involve the honest *person_mentioned*farmers */person_mentioned*in difficulty with the *person_mentioned*authorities */person_mentioned*if they could increase their own profits thereby.*/p*
*p*The political events of the past year necessarily produced a temporary and partial disorganization in the *person_mentioned*regular administration of the Govt*/person_mentioned* all over the *location_mentioned*nation */location_mentioned*which as a matter of course extended to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*everything is now settled down again upon the constitutional basis and the regular operation of the laws and of all the *person_mentioned*legal authorities*/person_mentioned* has been restored. The temporary and provisional measures which the peculiar exigencies of the times may have rendered necessary to pursue the public tranquility and protect persons and property are consequently ceased all over the nation and I have assured the *person_mentioned*Comt. General*/person_mentioned* that they will also cease as a matter of course in *location_mentioned*Tejas*/location_mentioned*. I therefore particularly recommend that what ever temporary deviation of the *person_mentioned*Militia */person_mentioned*or in any other matter should be corrected without delay and everything restored again to the legal basis as has been done all over the *location_mentioned*nation*/location_mentioned*. The *person_mentioned*Genl Congress*/person_mentioned* adjourned on the *date_mentioned n="05-20-1833">20th of this month*/date_mentioned* and as there will not be another regular session untill *date_mentioned n="01-xx-1834">January next*/date_mentioned*—my Journey to *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned* was rendered measurably useless. I have also been very much debilitated by Dysentary or Cholorina which prevails here. These considerations determined me to postpone my trip to the *location_mentioned*Capital */location_mentioned*for the present and I forwarded the memorial of the convention through the *person_mentioned*Comt General*/person_mentioned*. Since then my health has improved and an opportunity haveing very unexpectedly offered of a passage to *location_mentioned*Vera Cruz*/location_mentioned* by *location_mentioned*sea */location_mentioned*I have concluded to embrace it and shall depart in a few hours.*/p*
*p*I will close by assuring you that I have the most unlimited confidence in the patrotism liberality and Justice of the *person_mentioned*Govt */person_mentioned*and I rely with full confidence upon the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Tejas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* to sustain firmly all the *person_mentioned*authorities both federal and State*/person_mentioned* and to obey the laws strictly.*/p*
*p*By so doing they will procure a *person_mentioned*State Govt*/person_mentioned* and keep away large and unnecessary *person_mentioned*military Garrisons*/person_mentioned* and obtain everything that a reasonable people ought to expect or a just and *person_mentioned*liberal Govt*/person_mentioned* ought to grant.*/p*
*p*I recommend that the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Tejas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* should be mild calm and firm in favour of making a *location_mentioned*state of Tejas*/location_mentioned* by legal and constitutional means and by no other.*/p*
*p*To the *person_mentioned*Aymt of Nacogdoches*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*A true copy of the original. *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="07-10-1833">10 July 1833*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Adolfo Stern */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
